author: dao.coders
title: DAO-NET: Voting Wallet Integration
description: DAO-NET currently only allows users to vote on budget and other issues using a centralized website which limits its adoption rate and resilience to attacks.

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree that the proposal meets the challenge requirements.

Developing a wallet-based voting solution for DAOs is a valuable step forward in decentralising the proposal’s existing platform which supplies DAO tools.  
Voting is essential to governance on DAO’s and any software development in this area will certainly benefit Cardano by making DAO’s increasingly easy to set up on the blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1:
I agree the proposed plans and budget seem feasible to deliver.  
I would have scored 5/5 however the team have not confirmed cooperation with an existing open-source wallet team, and say they will resort to forking a wallet if they cannot gain cooperation.  Forking a wallet means a greater workload and in-house expertise needed to keep the wallet up to date and developing with Cardano.  This is not desirable outcome unless the team want to branch out into wallet software.
Investigation into a suitable wallet should have been conducted and confirmed prior to this proposal.

The timeline, team and budget all appear reasonable to complete the proposal.  The team expertise, funding amount requested and duration of the project appear achievable.
f6_assessments.q2:
I agree the proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

Regular reporting including KPI’s such as number of votes and transactions put through the voting app should ensure acceptable auditability.
If the voting code integration with the open-source wallet is to be on github, the proposal should include the communication of this also.  This should be specificied in the proposal as the chief auditable deliverable.

f6_assessments.q0: The submitted proposal clearly understands the challenge and offers a practical solution to the problem: They will integrate its voting interface with one or more open source wallets to make the solution more decentralized and to increase adoption via introduction to existing wallet users. The mission of the campaign is fulfilled by this solution. In addition, the proposer has made it clear that the long-term goal is to implement a wallet for DAO tokens. This will increase Cardano adoption and integration, which is one of the main requirements of the challenge. The proposal in its entirety could have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem. I give a point deduction for not mentioning in detail how the project differentiates itself from similar projects (in Catalyst and Cardano).
f6_assessments.q1: The action plan and potential challenges are described in detail. The funds requested also seem realistic, yet I would like to see a more detailed breakdown. The phased breakdown of the milestones and the time limit within which they are to be achieved also seem reasonable. But again, more detail could be provided. What is positive to point out is that the team has already funded several projects and has already gained experience in the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided a lot of meaningful information, with external links [profiles, resources, documents] for verification. In that regard, there is a github repo linked, so anyone interested can have a look inside and follow the progress of the proposal.  The metrics mentioned are relevant to the end goal and project success. The roadmap and milestones are also broken down well, but as mentioned could provide a more detailed step by step plan for reaching success. A clear and understandable description is provided as well as practical explanation is provided.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer identified that DAO-NET currently only allows users to vote on budget and other issues using a centralized website.  This limits the adoption rate of DAO-NET and resilience to attacks. The solution is a mobile and web browser extension version of a voting client application that will be used by DAO-NET members to vote on budgets, other issues, and to manage DAO-NET tokens.  The ultimate goal is to have available for users an existing open source wallet for Cardano with additional features and multiple languages added to that wallet. A link of the existing web server based interface, that will be integrated into the new voting dapp and wallets is provided.  
The projects KPIs are aligned with those of the challenge in that it provides direction of integration with existing products including DAO-NET itself and ADA wallets, granting users the ability to manage DAO-NET voting and tokens using a decentralized application.  This will make the DAO-NET ecosystem more resilient towards attempts to shut the system down by targeting the current centralized website.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team constitutes of a product manager and a lead developer.  Wallet developers are needed to work for the project who were not identified yet at the time of submission.  The credentials of the two team members are supported by links to their profiles and past work experience.  Provided is a detail timeline of a 4 month implementation. Each month certain tasks will be completed.  The budget is detailed based upon the timeline provided.  The costs are broken down in monthly payments per worker.    
The main challenge will be finding an existing open source wallet developers with which to partner. The proposer already has available a list of open source wallets with the developers so identifying interest should be straightforward. If this does not work, then the only option is to fork the most compatible open source wallet and perform all the work with the DAO Coders consulting team.  The proposer realizes the actual risk of implementing the project but does not hesitate or fear to implement it.  He came up with solutions and he is very optimistic about the project.  It is  a great idea and he knows that.  The optimism comes out of his words.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provided a clear and realistic roadmap and timeline broken down in 4 phases implemented in 4 months.  Each phase is described in detail and is easily understandable.  The roadmap and timeline are aligned with the requested budget.  The KPIs are clear enough for the Community to track progress of the project.  The team will provide on a daily basis the number users using the voting dapp starting in the testing phase. The monthly report provided to Project Catalyst will show a chart of the number of users.  The information will be gathered via data mining the blockchain.

f6_assessments.q0:
According to the idea, DAO-NET will connect its voting interface with one or more open source wallets. This will promote adoption by introducing the solution to the current wallet users and to increase the decentralisation of the solution. In this proposal, a mobile and web browser will be developed so that members can manage their DAO-NET tokens and vote on budgets.
The idea demonstrates a demonstrable increase in value for the Cardano ecosystem and The proposal's main metrics and objectives line up with the described challenge circumstances.
Future issues can be addressed by scaling the proposal.
Along with tackling the challenges and risks, the proposal also included a plan of action.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project's proposer has offered a comprehensive plan, complete with a timeframe and significant checkpoints.
Both the stated timeline and the budget breakdown are excellent.
The proposal has taken into account the pertinent risks and obstacles for the successful execution, which is a wonderful approach to the topic.
After reading the idea, I concur that it is likely to be implemented effectively. The proposer has also provided a description of the team in depth and a list of the team members' necessary skills.
f6_assessments.q2:
When finished, the voting dapp would have a community of more than a thousand daily users actively involved in developing or funding projects, DAOs, and services. By looking at this we can measure the successes of the proposal .The proposer have provided the clear understandable description of the challenge and The approach for the successful implementation is described.
The Metrices/Kpi's mentioned in the proposal define the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Here's what needs to be addressed on this challenge DAO-NET currently only allows users to vote on budgets and other issues using an issue-focused website that fits the current challenge . The problem is clearly defined and it fits this challenge. The solution to the author's problem is that DAO-NET will integrate its voting interface with one or more open source wallets to make the solution more decentralized and increase its acceptability through tokenization. present to current wallet users. This is how the author solves the problem. The risk is also mentioned by the author in the challenge that the current open source wallet may have problems and require more workload than the scope of this proposal but they have also provided a workaround for the problem. this topic.
f6_assessments.q1: The presentation plan is listed in detail by the author, and the process and timeline are clearly listed by the author through 4 stages of activities. For the period of September 1, the period of October 2, the period of November 3 and the period of December 4, the author also clearly lists the to-dos of each month. This project aligns with existing products including DAO NET and also ADA decentralized application wallet which will make the DAO NET ecosystem more flexible. The launch of this application is expected to attract many newcomers to the Cardano ecosystem. The success of the project is clearly described by the author as the result is that they will have a community of more than 1000 users a day actively participating in the creation or funding of increasingly larger projects. The maximum decentralized DAO-NET ecosystem that will become part of the overall Cardano ecosystem these are the successes that the author described what they would achieve if funded. This is a good project if it can be cabled, I think they will do well in their project.
f6_assessments.q2: The progress of the project is completely trackable. They will measure the number of users using the dapp voting on a daily basis, starting from the testing phase. In general, followers can check the project's activities and know the number of participants based on a graph showing daily usage that will be included in the monthly progress report for Project Catalyst. This information will be collected through data mining on the blockchain. About Team DAO Coders Inc is an experienced group of Blockchain developers, Plutus pioneers, Veteran Community Advisors, and Solution Analysts that were merged after the previous round of funding for some proposed DAO-NET suite. They include Dwayne Collard he is a product manager with 20 years and IT consultant, Jude Ben is a lead developer with 9 years in software development, Plutus smart contract developer and developer wallets will be recruited by the team after the project is funded. These are the elite members they are the right people to take on the above tasks who will be the main responsible for this proposal. With their existing skills and experience I believe the project will be successful. This proposal's funding budget is $30.000 less than 20% of the entire challenge's budget. The budget is detailed by the author to spend, this is a budget suitable for this challenge.

solution: DAO-NET will integrate its voting interface with one or more open source wallets to make the solution more decentralized and to increase adoption via introduction to existing wallet users.
experience: DAO Coders Inc is an experienced team of Blockchain developers, Plutus pioneers, Veteran Community Advisors and Solutions Analysts that was incorporated after previous round funding for several DAO-NET suite proposals, which are available for viewing and testing (see link below).
